title: Alcaraz splits with coach after 7 years, 6 Slams
content: Top-ranked Carlos Alcaraz is ending his pairing with longtime coach Juan Carlos Ferrero, a partnership that resulted in six Grand Slam titles.

title: At 42-0, Crawford retires: 'Nothing left to prove'
content: Five-division champion Terence Crawford announced his retirement from boxing Tuesday, saying he was "walking away as a great with nothing else left to prove."

title: Love heads to NFL draft after stellar Irish run
content: Jeremiyah Love, the star Notre Dame running back and Heisman Trophy finalist, made it official Tuesday night and declared for the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Silver: NBA expansion decision will be made in '26
content: Adam Silver laid out a definitive timeline for expansion for the first time, saying a decision will be made sometime in 2026 on whether to add more NBA teams.

title: Despite loss, Spurs take positives from Cup run
content: Despite losing to the Knicks in Tuesday's NBA Cup championship game, the Spurs believe their experience in such high-stakes matchups will only benefit them as they build toward a postseason run.

title: Kerr: Lacob email no big deal; Dubs all frustrated
content: Steve Kerr acknowledged a leaked email exchange between Warriors owner Joe Lacob and a fan that illustrated frustrations with the team, but he maintained that he and Lacob still have a "great connection."

title: ACC unveils 'transition' 2026 conference schedule
content: Twelve of the ACC's 17 schools will play nine conference football games in 2026, while five schools, with already scheduled Power Four opponents, will play eight games.

title: üìù Choose your own adventure: You're the AD!
content: The athletic director job has never been tougher in this era of NIL, paying players and the transfer portal. Guide your school to glory.

content: Here's the latest, including intel on Patrick Mahomes, Micah Parsons, Philip Rivers, playoff races and offseason trade candidates.

content: John Harbaugh grumbling about an overturned TD is an example of why the NFL pays attention to complaints.

content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: The anti-anhedonic Aggies: Can Mike Elko and this Texas A&M team make all the talk about the past stop?
content: The Aggies head into their first College Football Playoff appearance looking to banish the program's ghosts.

content: Amen Thompson and Alperen Sengun spent the offseason 6,000 miles apart as they worked to reach a new level this season.

title: Power Rankings: Cavaliers and 76ers cling onto contention in East
content: NBA insiders break down where all 30 teams stand in this week's rankings ahead of the holiday season.

title: Inside the ugly Chris Paul-Clippers divorce -- and a season on the brink of disaster
content: A future Hall of Famer at the end of his career, looking for one final ride. Here's why the Chris Paul-Clippers reunion was doomed.

title: Geek and destroy: How Bruins winger Morgan Geekie has defied goal-scoring regression
content: Many expected the 27-year-old to take a step back from his 33 goals last season. Instead, he's on pace for 58.

title: MLB free agency reset: Predictions for the remaining top 10 free agents
content: A number of impact players are off the market, but there are still big names to be signed. Where do they fit best?

title: Updated contract projections for the top four free agent hitters
content: Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber getting big bucks could help bring bigger paydays to other available hitters.

title: Reranking the top 10 men's basketball Freshman of the Year contenders
content: North Carolina's Caleb Wilson rounds out a solid top three while three new names crack the latest edition.

title: A reason (or two) to watch every one of this season's bowl games
content: With first-year success stories, redemption  chances and general silliness, bowl season always delivers.

title: English soccer's drinking culture has faded from Rooney to now, but it's not gone
content: Wayne Rooney's honesty about his battle with alcohol during his prime has brought English soccer's issues back to the forefront. The one positive might be how clubs are investing in resources and care to help.

title: Projecting Golden Boy, Girl 2026: Est√™v√£o, Yohannes to succeed Dou√©, Agyemang?
content: PSG's D√©sir√© Dou√© and Arsenal's Michelle Agyemang won the 2025 Golden Boy and Girl awards for the best player under the age of 21, but who could win it next year?

title: Bracketology: Five contenders -- and everyone else
content: UConn, Texas, South Carolina and UCLA remain 1-seeds -- and LSU is the only real challenger behind them.

title: AP poll reaction: Longhorns remain UConn's biggest rival
content: The sixth in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Updated Top 100 rankings for the 2026 NBA draft: Which top prospects are rising and falling?
content: Which top prospects shifted the most on our first rankings update? Here's our 100 big board for the 2026 class.

title: Scouts, coaches weigh in on three-man race for No. 1 pick of 2026 NBA draft
content: It's a tight race at the top of the 2026 draft. We talked to insiders to learn where things stand now.

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- or falling -- after 15 weeks? Our new Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 16. We also looked at players who could get contract extensions this offseason.

title: Spinning Week 15 forward: Broncos and Rams clinched ... can they reach the Super Bowl?
content: Sizing up the Broncos and Rams in their respective conferences, Philip Rivers' return to the NFL and more.

title: Ranking Jake Paul's boxing matches: Which knockout earned No. 1?
content: What moments have been the best and worst of Jake Paul's boxing career? Andreas Hale ranks each of Paul's fights.

title: Individual rankings for Week 16
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Early Week 16 bets: Broncos over Jaguars, Drake Maye to win MVP among picks
content: Which lines offered value once odds came out? Here are games we are eyeing for bets going into Week 16.

title: Pickups: Add Portis, Kuzma while Giannis is sidelined
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Fernandes on Bayern radar
content: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes has hit the headlines recently and is now on the radar of Bayern Munich. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'Kept begging': How delay & refusals led to Bengaluru man‚Äôs death on road; wife donates his eyes
content: A 34-year-old mechanic died after a scooter fall while being rushed to the hospital following a heart attack. His wife alleges that a private hospital's delay in treatment and the apathy of passing motorists contributed to his death. She is demanding action against the hospital and urging for greater public compassion.

title: Nuclear Energy Bill 2025: Lok Sabha clears 'SHANTI' bill as opposition walks out
content: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday SHANTI Bill, 2025, paving the way for private sector participation in India's nuclear energy industry. This legislation (yet to be passed in Rajya Sabha) introduces a new civil liability framework and strengthens the Atomic Energy Regulatory Board. While crucial operations remain government-controlled, the bill aims to boost nuclear power capacity and applications, encouraging investment in the sector.

title: 'Action on those below BS-IV': SC modifies order on older vehicles exemption in Delhi
content: The Supreme Court has revised its order on older vehicles, now targeting those failing BS-IV emission standards amid Delhi's severe air pollution. The court also urged practical solutions, including temporary suspension of nine toll plazas to curb traffic congestion and pollution. Direct financial aid for affected construction workers was also discussed.

title: We are really trying, says Microsoft AI chief: Gemini 3 can do things that Copilot can‚Äôt
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman stated that Google's Gemini 3 can perform tasks beyond Copilot's capabilities, while Copilot excels in real-time visual assistance. He emphasized Microsoft's commitment to developing "humanist superintelligence" systems designed to serve human interests, vowing to abandon any AI that becomes uncontrollable.

title: Messi event fiasco: Who is Aroop Biswas? TMC min who gave up sports portfolio
content: State Sports Minister Aroop Biswas has stepped down temporarily following public outrage over the botched Lionel Messi event. The Chief Minister will oversee the sports portfolio until a fair inquiry is completed. This move aims to quell public anger and deflect opposition criticism, though Biswas retains other ministerial roles.

title: Warner Bros deal battle: Company tells shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance bid
content: Warner Bros urged shareholders to reject Paramount Skydance's takeover, favoring a Netflix offer they believe benefits customers and aligns with board duties. Paramount's higher bid includes cable networks, unlike Netflix's streaming-focused proposal. Both deals face significant regulatory and political scrutiny, with concerns about market dominance and media consolidation.

title: 'Mamata must clarify': BJP claims TMC MP Kirti Azad vaped inside Lok Sabha; shares video
content: The BJP shared a video alleging Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Kirti Azad vaped inside the Lok Sabha. BJP MP Anurag Thakur had previously complained to the Speaker. The incident is being taken seriously. Lok Sabha Secretariat sources stated that appropriate action will follow examination of the recordings. The alleged act is a serious violation of parliamentary conduct and rules.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5%, at its European headquarters in Luxembourg, impacting software developers most due to AI advancements. This is company's biggest ever job cuts in the Europe, following global layoffs back in October and a negotiated social plan. Despite the reduction, Luxembourg remains a strategic European hub for Amazon, which continues to hire in key areas.

title: Big blow for India! Shubman Gill likely to miss 4th T20I vs South Africa due to toe injury
content: Shubman Gill picked up the injury during training on Wednesday, putting his availability for the Playing XI in doubt. Team management is expected to take a final call at the toss. India currently lead the five-match series 2-1.

title: Pathirana is a huge risk': Former India captain cautions KKR after Rs 18-crore buy
content: Krishnamachari Srikkanth expressed surprise at Matheesha Pathirana's INR 18 crore IPL 2026 auction price, calling him a "hit-and-miss" bowler. Despite a mixed last season, Pathirana attracted intense bidding, with KKR securing him and Mustafizur Rahman as a smart backup. Srikkanth questioned the aggressive pursuit, comparing it to other players who faltered after one poor season.

title: Carpooling app, Rs 2.7k crore push: Delhi minister outlines plan to curb toxic air
content: Delhi environment minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Wednesday announced that his government is launching its own carpooling app as the pollution level rises in National capital. He also announced a Rs 2700-crore allocation over 10 years to the MCD.

title: Humans vs Robots: iRobot co-founder on why Robots can‚Äôt be like humans; sends message to Musk
content: Robotics pioneer Rodney Brooks warns that the vision of humanoid robots as general assistants is unrealistic due to a biological barrier: dexterity. He argues that current AI cannot learn the complexity of human touch from datasets, making video training methods insufficient for achieving true physical capability. Brooks predicts future successful robots will likely be non-humanoid, featuring wheels and multiple arms.

title: ‚ÄòBehave responsibly‚Äô: BJP slams Rahul over remarks in Germany, says shows his sentiments for India
content: The BJP on Wednesday hit back at Rahul Gandhi over the his criticism of Centre's manufaturing policy during his visit to Germany. BJP MP Sambit Patra salmmed leader of opposition in Lok Sabha accusing him of insulting India on foreign soil at a time when parliament is in session. He  saying, LoP is a responsibe position and should behave  in ‚Äúresponsible manner."

title: Pace is pace: Ashok‚Äôs 150 kph rise, powered by Cummins‚Äô valuable advice | Exclusive
content: Ashok Sharma‚Äôs journey from a farming village near Jaipur to clocking 150 kph is a story of sacrifice, mentorship and unwavering belief in pace. Guided by his late coach Vivek Yadav, backed by Anshu Jain, and shaped by advice from Pat Cummins and Bharat Arun, the 23-year-old has emerged as the standout bowler of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. With raw speed now married to control, Ashok is fast becoming the speedster to watch out for.

title: Ayesha Curry admits she never expected to fall for NBA legend Stephen Curry
content: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's love story began in childhood at church, though they didn't start dating until their teenage years. Ayesha's unwavering support, even encouraging Stephen to finish his degree before the NBA draft, solidified his decision to marry her. Their enduring marriage has weathered public scrutiny, with Stephen consistently crediting his wife.

title: Sherrone Moore‚Äôs wife Kelli decides future amid alleged Paige Shiver affair
content: Sherrone Moore and Paige Shiver's alleged affair drama sparked chaos among fans but it seems now his wife, Kelli Moore, has stepped into the drama, days after he was released from police custody. While Sherrone Moore faces serious accusations, Kelli Moore might have made a decision about her marriage and future.

title: NBA injury update: Wembanyama to play as Spurs face Knicks in NBA Cup final
content: The NBA Cup final features the Spurs against the Knicks in Las Vegas. Victor Wembanyama is back for the Spurs after an injury, ready to play any role needed.  Despite his eagerness to start, the team is carefully managing his minutes.  The Knicks will have their full starting lineup for this high-stakes championship game.

title: James Cameron makes surprising request to SS Rajamouli
content: Hollywood maestro James Cameron expressed his admiration for Indian director S.S. Rajamouli, even requesting to visit his film sets.  Cameron's 'Avatar' franchise, lauded by Rajamouli as a benchmark for big-screen experiences, is set for a massive multi-language release in India. This exchange highlights a significant creative connection between Indian and Hollywood cinema.

title: 'Total failure': SC slams 'ad-hoc' measures for toxic Delhi air; directs to close 9 toll plazas
content: The Supreme Court is pushing for practical solutions to Delhi's severe air pollution crisis. It has directed the Delhi government to directly transfer funds to verified idle construction workers and consider providing them alternative work. The court also criticized the affluent for violating pollution norms, highlighting the disproportionate impact on the poor.

title: Shannon Sharpe sounds alarm on Anthony Richardson after Colts move
content: Shannon Sharpe sharply criticized the Indianapolis Colts' decision to start veteran Philip Rivers over Anthony Richardson, suggesting the team has lost faith in their top draft pick. Sharpe cited Richardson's "tap out" moment as a sign of a lack of mental toughness, while also acknowledging the Colts may have rushed his development.

title: Who was Christina Chambers? US sports reporter found dead in Alabama home
content: US sports reporter Christina Chambers and her husband were tragically found dead in their Alabama home, with police investigating the incident as a murder-suicide. Their infant child was discovered unharmed. Chambers, remembered as a bright presence and dedicated educator, left a significant impact on the local sports media and her students. Tributes highlight her positive influence and professionalism.

title: ‚ÄòNehru papers not missing‚Äô: Govt clarifies after Congress seeks apology
content: The government on Wednesday issued clarification on the "missing" Nehru papers after Congress demanded apology from the Centre. The controversy erupted after government made a statement in Parliament asserting that no papers are missing from PMML. However, they clarified that papers are not missing in the sense that there whereabouts are unknown but alleged that some papers were handed to Sonia Gandhi in 2008.

title: Rs 14.2 crore IPL bonanza! 'Maza aa raha hai': Rinku Singh teases Prashant Veer - Watch
content: Uttar Pradesh spinner Prashant Veer achieved a lifelong dream on December 16, 2025, securing an IPL contract with Chennai Super Kings for a staggering Rs 14.20 crore, making him the joint-most expensive uncapped player ever.  The 20-year-old expressed immense joy and surprise at the opportunity to play alongside MS Dhoni, aiming to learn from the legend's vast experience.

title: Big boost: Army receives final batch of 3 Apache AH-64E attack helicopters - see pics
content: India's Army Aviation Corps has received the final three AH-64E Apache attack helicopters, completing its contracted fleet. These advanced aircraft, set to be based in Jodhpur, significantly boost the Army's attack and reconnaissance capabilities. This delivery marks a key milestone in the growing US-India defence partnership, enhancing regional security cooperation.

title: SSN College to stop admissions from 2026‚Äì27: What changes & what this means for students ?
content: SSN College of Engineering will stop taking new students from 2026‚Äì27, shifting future engineering admissions to the SSN School of Engineering under Shiv Nadar University Chennai. For students, the big change is not the campus but the gate: TNEA‚Äôs rank-led route (no JEE needed) gives way to a university process. Fees, too, move from state norms to university slabs.

title: Defying Trump sanctions? India's oil imports from Russia hit 1m barrels a day
content: Despite US sanctions on Russian oil majors, Indian refiners are maintaining robust crude imports. December shipments are expected to exceed 1 million barrels per day, driven by deep discounts from non-sanctioned entities. While some refiners are pausing purchases, others are increasing their intake, ensuring continued trade flow.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 13 (LIVE): Movie inches towards Rs 420 crore in India
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is shattering box office records, becoming his highest earner ever and surpassing 'Padmaavat'. The film has achieved unprecedented numbers, including a massive opening weekend and week, and setting new benchmarks for an A-rated Hindi film. Its second week collections are proving historic, demonstrating incredible audience reception.

title: How to spot comet 3I/ATLAS on 19th December
content: NASA is undertaking a vast observation effort for comet 3I/ATLAS. This interstellar visitor is being studied by multiple spacecraft and telescopes. Researchers aim to understand its composition and origin by comparing it with solar system comets. The comet will be closest to Earth on December 19, offering a viewing opportunity with telescopes.

title: Bharat Taxi to roll out in Delhi from Jan 1; 56,000 drivers already on board
content: A new driver-owned ride-hailing service, Bharat Taxi, is set to launch in Delhi on January 1, challenging existing platforms. Promoted by Sahakar Taxi Cooperative Limited, it boasts 56,000 registered drivers and promises them nearly 80% of earnings. Beta trials are underway, with the platform aiming to empower drivers with complete ownership and a zero-commission structure.

title: Why‚Äç‚Äå‚Äç‚Äç‚Äå‚Äç‚Äå‚Äç‚Äç‚Äå skin on feet becomes hard and thick?
content: Hard skin on feet develops gradually due to constant pressure and friction. This thickening is the skin's way of protecting itself from mechanical stress.  Ignoring these changes can lead to painful cracks and infections.  Proper moisturising and supportive footwear are key to maintaining healthy, flexible foot skin.  Addressing discomfort early prevents further complications.

title: Highest rating by an Indian! Varun creates history; tightens grip on No.1 T20I ranking
content: Mystery spinner Varun Chakaravarthy has reached a career-best rating, solidifying his No.1 spot in ICC T20I bowler rankings. His exceptional performance against South Africa, including crucial wickets, bolsters India's T20 World Cup defence hopes.  Pacer Arshdeep Singh and batter Tilak Varma also saw significant rankings improvements, adding to India's growing optimism.

title: NBA Cup prize money breakdown: How much Knicks players will earn
content: The New York Knicks are close to winning the NBA Cup.  A victory means a substantial prize of over $500,000 for each player on a standard contract.  This financial incentive is a major draw for players.  Even reaching the final guarantees a significant payout.  The league views the NBA Cup as a serious competition with playoff-level intensity.

title: Gold price today: How much yellow metal costs in Delhi, Mumbai & other cities? Check rates
content: Gold prices saw a slight dip on Wednesday while silver futures surged to new record highs on the Multi Commodity Exchange.  Silver's rise was fueled by global factors and anticipated US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.  Gold prices varied across major Indian cities, with some experiencing minor increases.  The market displayed contrasting movements for the precious metals.

title: 'Thank you for giving me new life': Sarfaraz Khan shares emotional note after CSK pick
content: Chennai Super Kings secured Sarfaraz Khan at his base price of Rs 75 lakh, a move fueled by his recent explosive Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy performance.  The franchise also made significant investments in uncapped talents Kartik Sharma and Prashant Veer, alongside acquiring Matt Henry and Rahul Chahar.  This strategic recruitment follows a major trade that saw Sanju Samson join CSK.

title: Anaya Bangar reacts with joy as CSK sign 'close friend' Sarfaraz Khan at IPL 2026 auction
content: Anaya Bangar celebrated her close friend Sarfaraz Khan's IPL return with Chennai Super Kings at the IPL 2026 mini-auction. Sarfaraz, picked at his base price, expressed gratitude for the "new life" from CSK. The long-standing friendship between Anaya and Sarfaraz was highlighted, with Anaya sharing memories of their early days in cricket.

title: Goa nightclub blaze probe: One of Luthra brothers complains of chest pain, taken to hospital
content: Co-owners of the nightclub where a deadly fire claimed 25 lives, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, experienced a medical emergency upon their return to Goa for the probe. One sibling complained of chest pain and uneasiness shortly after landing, hours after their deportation from Thailand and arrest in Delhi.

title: Why LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky thinks 5-year career plans no longer make sense
content: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky argues that five-year career plans no longer match today‚Äôs fast-changing workplace. Calling such planning outdated, he urges professionals to prioritise learning, adaptability, and experimentation with tools like AI. In an era of non-linear careers, Roslansky stresses personal agency, short-term skill-building, and the enduring value of human judgment and communication.

title: Message to Trump? Sitharaman says 'trade getting weaponised through tariffs'
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted that global trade is increasingly being weaponized through tariffs and other measures. She warned India must negotiate carefully in this evolving landscape, where trade is no longer free and fair. Sitharaman emphasised that India's actions aim to protect domestic industries from unfair competition and predatory practices.

title: Delhi pollution: China shares tips for India; adds 'challenge remains complex'
content: As Delhi grapples with severe air pollution, the Chinese Embassy in India shared its nation's strategies for tackling the issue. China implemented ultra-strict vehicle emission controls, including phasing out old vehicles and promoting electric mobility. The country also undertook industrial restructuring, shutting down heavy industries and transforming former factory sites into public spaces and economic hubs.

title: No quick fix: Delhi govt announces strict restrictions as AQI soars; 50% WFH mandatory
content: Delhi faces severe air pollution, prompting the government to implement Stage-IV GRAP restrictions. Measures include 50% work from home, mandatory PUC certificates for fuel, and a ban on construction material trucks. Officials acknowledge the long-standing nature of the pollution crisis and the need for sustained efforts.

title: Royal farewell: Ethiopian PM drives PM Modi to airport in rare gesture; see pics
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a rare personal diplomatic honour in Ethiopia as Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed Ali personally drove him to the airport. The visit saw the elevation of India-Ethiopia ties to a Strategic Partnership and PM Modi being conferred Ethiopia's highest civilian honour, highlighting growing Indian diplomatic stature.

title: Exclusive | More than politician Pappu Yadav's son: Sarthak Ranjan‚Äôs battle, breakdown and breakthrough
content: Overshadowed by his parents‚Äô towering political identities, Sarthak Ranjan fought prejudice, self-doubt and mental battles to keep his cricketing dream alive. A revival through the Delhi Premier League and a Rs 30 lakh IPL deal with KKR now mark the first real step in his quest to be known for his talent ‚Äî not his surname.

title: Inside Connor McDavid‚Äôs luxury car collection: supercars, favorites, and what makes it unique
content: Hockey superstar Connor McDavid's impressive car collection mirrors his on-ice prowess. Featuring a diverse range from the roaring Lamborghini Hurac√°n and precise Audi R8 to the luxurious Range Rover Vogue and powerful Chevrolet Camaro ZL1, his fleet showcases speed, precision, and personality. The Porsche 911 GT2 RS stands out as his favorite, embodying his passion for high-performance engineering.

title: "Showing True Colours": Omar Abdullah Slams Nitish Kumar Over Hijab Video
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Wednesday criticised his Bihar counterpart over the hijab incident and said that Nitish Kumar might be slowly revealing his true nature.

title: "Only BS-4 And Above": Supreme Court Tweaks Order On Older Vehicles In Delhi
content: Only vehicles with BS4 engines will be exempted from action if they are found running in Delhi, the Supreme Court said today, modifying its earlier order banning 10-year-old diesel-run vehicles and 15-year-old petrol-run vehicles from December 18.

title: Key Suspect In Punjab Kabaddi Player's Murder Killed In Police Encounter
content: Two days after a 30-year-old kabaddi player was shot dead in the middle of a tournament in Punjab's Mohali, the main accused, Harwinder alias Middu, was killed in a police encounter.

title: Opinion: Blog | "It Was A Shell From My Tank": When A Father Met The Pak Soldier Who Killed His Son
content: "He stood like a rock before our Patton tanks," Brigadier Naser (retd) told Madan Lal Khetarpal, almost three decades after his son was killed in battle.

title: 7.6% Voters Removed From West Bengal Draft Roll, 1.6 Crore Under Scanner
content: About 58 lakh voters, amounting to 7.6 per cent, were removed from the voter list because they have died, moved away, were absent or were registered more than once.

title: 'Md Salim Awasthi': CPM Leader, A Muslim, Becomes Brahmin In SIR Draft Roll
content: In an epic error during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists in West Bengal, CPM's state general secretary and former MP, Mohammed Salim, and his son, Atish Aziz, have been given a Brahmin last name -- Awasthi -- in the draft roll

title: "Why Can't 9 Tolls Be Shut Till Jan?" Supreme Court On Delhi Air Pollution
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday issued a sharp notice to the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and came down heavily on the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) over the operation of toll plazas at key entry points to the national capital.

title: With Freebies, OpenAI, Google Vie For Indian Users And Training Data
content: OpenAI, Google and Perplexity have begun an unprecedented fight for artificial intelligence users in India, rolling out freebies in a strategy seen as a way to harvest troves of multilingual training data in the world's most populous nation.

title: How Did Bondi Bystander Disarm Shooter Deftly? Past Job May Be The Answer
content: Many who watched the video of a bystander disarm one of the killers during the Sydney mass shooting that left 15 dead have wondered how he found the courage and the strength to pull off the brave act

title: "Covered In Blood, I Pleaded, None Helped": Bengaluru Woman Recounts Tragedy
content: Bengaluru was witness to a heart-wrenching event yesterday that would put humanity to shame. A 34-year-old man was faced with complete indifference from a hospital and passersby and eventually met with an accident.

title: Trouble Mounts For Pakistan With Taliban's New Move Over Cross-Border River
content: Pakistan's mounting water crisis is likely to worsen, as the Taliban government in Afghanistan has decided to move ahead with its plans to divert water from the Kunar River towards the Nangarhar region in the country

title: India Shuts Visa Centre In Dhaka Amid Threats From Radical Bangladeshi Leaders
content: Amid a deteriorating security situation and the targeted hate and radical speeches towards India and its territorial sovereignty, the Indian Visa Application Centre in Dhaka has shut indefinitely.

title: Video: Ethiopian Singers Perform Vande Mataram, PM Modi Breaks Into Applause
content: PM Modi arrived in Addis Ababa from Jordan and received a ceremonial welcome at the National Palace ahead of the talks.

title: Pakistan To Sell 100% Stake In PIA After Bidders Demand Complete Control
content: Pakistan has decided to sell its entire 100 per cent stake in Pakistan International Airlines after bidders sought complete managerial control with no government role post-privatisation, local media reported on Wednesday.

title: Aadhaar Has Several Levels Of Protection, No Data Breach So Far: Centre
content: There has been no breach of Aadhaar card holders' data from the Unique Identification Authority of India's (UIDAI) database till date, Ministry of Electronics & IT said on Wednesday.

title: "Proud Of Indian Engineering": Rahul Gandhi Explores TVS-BMW Bike In Germany
content: Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi visited the BMW Welt and the BMW Plant in Munich, Germany, this week.

title: Before Abdul Kalam, BJP Floated Atal Bihari Vajpayee's Name For President: Book
content: Ashok Tandon, who served as Vajpayee's media advisor, related the episode in his book Atal Smaran, published by Prabhat Prakashan.

title: Philippines Rejects Being ISIS Training Hotspot After Bondi Beach Shooting
content: Philippines said there was no evidence that the country was being used for terrorist training, a day after it was revealed the men behind Australia's Bondi Beach mass shooting had spent November on a southern island known for Islamist insurgencies.

title: Top Court Transfers RG Kar Rape Murder Case To Calcutta High Court
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday transferred the RG Kar Medical College trainee doctor rape and murder case to the Calcutta High Court to monitor the implementation of its orders.

title: 24 Phones, 11 SIMs, Knives, 366 Grams Of Ganja Seized From Karnataka Jails
content: In an intensified crackdown on illegal activities inside Karnataka's prisons, authorities have seized mobile phones, weapons and narcotics during a statewide special drive conducted over the last 36 hours.

title: Free agent pickups: What can you do to replace Patrick Mahomes?
content: the 15th Sunday of the season featured several notable comebacks . a pair of season-ending knee injuries might be what defines this week for both the short and long term . the quarterbacks lost to the los Angeles Chargers, eliminating them from postseason contention .

title: How Wallstedt, Bussi and five other NHL goalies leveled up their play this season
content: jesper wallstedt is a Minnesota Wild goaltender who's rewriting the franchise's rookie record books . he's at the top of a goaltending wave bringing new freshmen to light in the season's first half . it's almost a mystery how these things work .

title: 150 prospects, 12 schools, 7 rounds: We stacked players in the CFP by NFL draft stock
content: the top 12 teams of the 2025 CFB season have plenty of prospects for the 2026 draft . we're identifying each player in the playoff who could be selected in the upcoming draft and which round they'd fit best right now . this is where things stand right now and a good picture of which teams could be sending a bunch of top talent to the early rounds .

title: Knicks conquer Cup, laud poise under 'pressure'
content: the new york Knicks beat the San Antonio Spurs 124-113 in the fourth quarter . the win could be a harbinger for the team that stands tallest in the Eastern Conference . it's a single-elimination tournament when you get to a certain point, coach says .

title: Takeaways, highlights as Knicks defeat Spurs to win NBA Cup
content: the new York Knicks beat the San Antonio Spurs 124-113 in the fourth quarter . the knicks are 2025 Emirates NBA Cup champions after beating the Spurs 35-19 . OG Anunoby had a team-high 28 points for new york, guard Jalen Brunson added 25 points .

title: Here's who is really to blame for Liverpool's struggles. Hint: It's not Salah or Slot
content: Mohamed Salah says he has been thrown under the bus . he thinks he was thrown in the bus, or he thought he's thrown . the blame lies with the guy who Salah said he "used to have a good relationship" with .

title: College football bowl season: MVPs for the first two bowl games of the season
content: south Carolina State beat Prairie View A&M 40‚Äì38 with a two-point conversion and stop in quadruple overtime . it's one of the most exciting times of the year as the 2025 bowl season is underway! make your picks Our college football experts provide their MVP picks for each of the 36 bowl games this season .

content: Judicial Magistrate First Class Mapusa Puja Sardesai remanded the two brothers in police custody for five days

content: It is seeking redressal of issues concerning farmers, workers and common people and an end to the anti-people policies of the governments

content: Last date for submission of entries is December 22 and the two top entries in each category will be given a token of appreciation at the third edition of Millet Mela to be held in the second week of January 2026

content: The Managing Director of Amaravati Growth and Infrastructure Corporation Limited has been vested with wide-ranging responsibilities, including preparation of Detailed Development Plans for special projects, designing and implementing projects, and operating and maintaining city-level services, subject to APCRDA approval

title: Bangla band, once the voice of a generation, to reunite after 20 years for one evening
content: For many Kolkatans who were in college in the 1990s, the Parash Pathar reunion performance is a trip down memory lane

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: BJP holds core committee meeting to discuss roadmap for 2026 Assembly poll

title: Mohali Kabaddi player killing: Suspect shot dead in encounter

title: Parliament passes Bill to repeal, amend 71 laws
content: Piloting the Repealing and Amending Bill, 2025, in the Rajya Sabha, Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal said it aimed at removing outdated laws, correcting errors that had crept in during the law-making process and removing discriminatory aspects of certain laws

content: Pointing out that the two missed installments of February and March amounted to nearly ‚Çπ5,000 crore, the Opposition urged her to let the House know where the money had gone

content: India is a major market for processors yet continues to depend on imported designs and supply chains; to this end the Indian government has pitched for a ‚Äòhomegrown processor technology‚Äô

content: The Supreme Court described the pollution crisis as an "annual feature" and called for pragmatic and practical solutions to tackle the menace

content: India needs to build meaningful manufacturing ecosystems for accelerating growth, Mr. Gandhi said in a social media post after a guided tour of BMW Welt and the BMW Plant in Munich

title: Speeding SUV crashes into roadside shed in Mailardevpally killing two

content: Preliminary inquiries have revealed that she had an argument with her father and fled from her home towards the LoC area before being apprehended by the Indian Army unit

title: Chhattisgarh Assembly session: 34 Congress members suspended after uproar over probe agency 'misuse'

title: 10 Ahmedabad schools get bomb threat, turns out to be hoax after search

title: Sabarimala gold row: SIT arrests former TDB administrative officer S. Sreekumar
content: Sreekumar's arrest comes barely two weeks after Kerala High Court rejected his anticipatory bail plea

title: Odisha man taken hostage in Sudan, returns to family

title: Goa nightclub fire: Luthra brothers sent to 5-day police custody; probe into tragedy widens
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: The future of governance in post-Maoist India

Effective governance is crucial to address these issues and mitigate the ongoing challenges in these regions
